textBeforeTable: Table 27-22 SQL*PLUS Activity Parameters It has a different set of substitution variables. The activity should be configured with a Deployed database location. If the ${Task.Input} substitution variable is used then the temporary file that is created will end in .sql. The COMMAND parameter cannot be specified as it is automatically derived. The SQL*PLUS activity is similar to the User Defined activity with the following differences: Under Path Settings, set the Deployed Location option to the location that will run the SQL*PLUS activity. Select SQLPLUS. In the Configuration tab, expand the SQL*PLUS Activities node. Right-click the process flow and select Configure. The Configuration tab for the process flow is displayed. In the Projects Navigator, expand the Process Flow module. To set the location that will run the SQL*PLUS activity: The process flow in SQL*PLUS activity is performed by the configuration item in the Deployed Location. Using SQL*PLUS Activities in Process Flows Although you can use this activity to accomplish a broad range of goals, one example is to use a SQL*PLUS activity to control how multiple mappings are committed in a process flow as described in "Committing Mappings through the Process Flow Editor".
